data.title: How to find your NetSuite account details to authorise your account
data.meta_description: To authenticate your Airwallex and NetSuite connection, you will need to provide the following information from your Oracle NetSuite...
data.text:
To authenticate your Airwallex and NetSuite connection, you will need to provide the following information from your Oracle NetSuite account.

Consumer Key

Consumer Secret

Token ID

Token Secret

Account ID

Please follow all the steps below to authenticate your connection.

Installing the bundle

Login to your NetSuite account and navigate to Customization > SuiteBundler > Search & Install Bundles.

Search for the Airwallex Bank Feeds bundle, input Airwallex Bank Feeds or 486224 and click “Search”.

Click the Airwallex Bank Feeds link.

In the bundle installation page, click Install.

Installation is completed once the status displays a check icon.

Enabling REST Web Services and Token-Based Authentication

Navigate to Setup > Company > Enable Features.

Under the SuiteCloud tab, look for REST Web Services and Token - Based Authentication.

Make sure both boxes are checked and click “Save”

Generating your Consumer Key and Consumer Secret

Navigate to Setup > Integration > Manage Integrations > New.

Check “Token-Based Authentication” only. Do not check other boxes.

Click 'Save' and your consumer key and secret will be displayed. Please save this information in a password protected document.

Generating your Token ID and Secret

Navigate to Setup > Users/Roles > Access Tokens > New

Enter the following information

a. Application name: Choose the application created in the previous step.

b. User: Select an employee record associated with the Airwallex Bank Feed Role.

c. Role: Airwallex Bank Feed Role, please make sure that you have associated the user with this role. You can configure this in Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles.

d. Token name: Keep as it is.

Finding your Account ID

To identify your Account ID, check the subdomain (highlighted in red box below) of your NetSuite URL.

Finding your Script ID

Click on Customization > Scripting > Scripts

Search for “bankfeeds_rest.js” under SCRIPT FILE

Use INTERNAL ID value as your Script ID
